body_html:
You're right. For save method, its argument write_meta_graph is True by default, see API tf.train.Saver:

save(
    sess,
    save_path,
    global_step=None,
    latest_filename=None,
    meta_graph_suffix='meta',
    write_meta_graph=True,
    write_state=True,
    strip_default_attrs=False
)
body_text:
You're right. For save method, its argument write_meta_graph is True by default, see API  tf.train.Saver:
save(
    sess,
    save_path,
    global_step=None,
    latest_filename=None,
    meta_graph_suffix='meta',
    write_meta_graph=True,
    write_state=True,
    strip_default_attrs=False
)
body:
You're right. For save method, its argument `write_meta_graph` is True by default, see API [ tf.train.Saver](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/train/Saver#save):

```python
save(
    sess,
    save_path,
    global_step=None,
    latest_filename=None,
    meta_graph_suffix='meta',
    write_meta_graph=True,
    write_state=True,
    strip_default_attrs=False
)
```
